H0.text: DNA is the target that cells have multiple repair mechanisms to fix mutations in.

H1.text: Amino acid chains are the structures that cells have multiple repair mechanisms to fix mutations in.

H2.text: Organ systems are the structures that cells have multiple repair mechanisms to fix mutations in.

H3.text: RNA is what cells have multiple repair mechanisms to fix mutations in.

A4.text: a mutation cannot be recognized by enzymes once the base change is present in both DNA strands, and thus a mutation cannot be repaired

A5.text: DNA repair is a collection of processes by which a cell identifies and corrects damage to the DNA molecules that encode its genome

A6.text: Heavy Metal Exposure Influences Double Strand Break DNA Repair Outcomes
